p: The 2014 Fifth Assessment Report of the U.N. Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) has further increased scientific evidence for global climate change in the twenty-first century (IPCC 2014). It describes the anthropogenic influence on the earthâ€™s climate, the observed warming of the atmosphere and oceans during the last century, and the warming still to be expected for the current century. The exact effects on temperature, precipitation patterns, and large-scale circulation patterns are, however, highly dependent on the amount of greenhouse gases emitted in the nearby future.
